Caption: A student receives an award from Sir C.V. Raman
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th of July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Institute’s Open Air Theater. The Chief Guest and speaker, at this historic event for the Institute, was none other than Dr. C. V. Raman, the Indian Physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna, for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. After the conferment of the Degrees, the Registrar presented the graduates for the award of prizes (President’s Prize, Governor’s Prize, Institute Special Merit Prize, Institute Merit Prizes and the Siemens Prizes) to the Chief Speaker who graciously handed over the prizes to them. Seen in the background: Prof. B. Sengupto
